SpeechRecognitionEvent.summary: The SpeechRecognitionEvent interface of the Web Speech API represents the event object for the and events, and contains all the data associated with an interim or final speech recognition result.

SpeechRecognitionEventResultIndex.summary:
The resultIndex read-only property of the
interface returns the lowest index value result in
the "array" that has actually changed.

remarks.para:
The object is not an array, but it has a
getter that allows it to be accessed by array syntax.

SpeechRecognitionEventResults.summary:
The results read-only property of the
interface returns a
object representing all the speech
recognition results for the current session.

remarks.para:
Specifically this object will contain all final results that have been returned,
followed by the current best hypothesis for all interim results. When subsequent
events are fired, interim results may be overwritten by a newer
interim result or by a final result â€” they may even be removed, if they are at the end
of the "results" array and the array length decreases. Final results on the other hand
will not be overwritten or removed.

SpeechRecognitionEventSpeechRecognitionE.summary:
The SpeechRecognitionEvent() constructor creates a new
object instance.
